text: scientists now think whether an animal
is predator or prey may drive the
evolution of its pupil prey species such
as goats and horses have horizontal
pupils while predators that ambush their
victims have vertical slits having eyes
on the sides of their heads and
horizontal pupils give prey animals a
panoramic view well-suited to spotting
predators the horizontal pupil enables
this wide view because it allows more
light to enter the eye from in front and
behind however when a horse or goat is
grazing it moves its head up and down
which could turn the eye vertical and
eliminate the benefits of the horizontal
pupil so the animals have evolved to
rotate their eyes to keep the pupil
parallel to the ground
an ability known as Psychlo Bergeon s'
